pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.12_0: “... Foolish man, how can you act disrespectfully?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.13_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.15.1_0: ‘If a monk is disrespectful, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Channa was misbehaving.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.3_0: When other monks asked him why,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.6_0: and he just did it again out of disrespect.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:1.9_0: “Is it true, Channa, that you’re acting disrespectfully?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.2_0: there are two kinds of disrespect: disrespect for the person and disrespect for the rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.4_0: if, when he is corrected by one who is fully ordained about a rule that has been laid down, he thinks, “They’ve been ejected,” “They’ve been reproved,” “They’ve been censured,” and then, “I won’t do what they say,” and he acts disrespectfully, then he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.1.6_0: if, when he is corrected by one who is fully ordained about a rule that has been laid down, he thinks, “What can be done so that this rule is lost or perishes or disappears,”or he does not want to train in that rule, and he acts disrespectfully, then he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.10_0: If it is to one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives them as such, and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive them as such, and he acts disrespectfully, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.4_0: If he is being corrected about something that has not been laid down—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.5_0: if a monk does not act out of disrespect, nor does he acts in line with energy, even for the purpose of going forth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.6_0: If he is being corrected by one who is not fully ordained, whether or not it has been laid down—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.7_0: if a monk does not act out of disrespect, nor does he acts in line with energy, even for the purpose of going forth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.8_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.2.9_0: If the one who corrects him is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.3.2_0: if he says, “This is how we were taught and tested by our teachers;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc54:2.3.5_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on disrespect, is finished.
